body:
I've also created a patch, which resolved the problem for me, at least.
I drew 'inspiration' for the approach from [https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/12590#issuecomment-96767796](here).
The patch is applied to `$VAGRANT_DIR\embedded\gems\gems\vagrant-2.0.0\plugins\providers\docker\driver.rb`.
The patch contents is:
```
--- driver_old.rb	2017-10-19 13:21:22.112377200 +0300
+++ driver.rb	2017-10-19 13:33:11.688813900 +0300
@@ -49,12 +49,21 @@
         run_cmd += volumes.map { |v|
           v = v.to_s
           if v.include?(":") && (Vagrant::Util::Platform.windows? || Vagrant::Util::Platform.wsl?)
-            host, guest = v.split(":", 2)
-            host = Vagrant::Util::Platform.windows_path(host)
-            # NOTE: Docker does not support UNC style paths (which also
-            # means that there's no long path support). Hopefully this
-            # will be fixed someday and the gsub below can be removed.
-            host.gsub!(/^[^A-Za-z]+/, "")
+            if Vagrant::Util::Platform.msys?
+              indx = v.rindex(":")
+              host, guest = v[0..indx-1], v[indx+1..-1]
+              host = '//' + host[0].downcase + host[2..-1]
+            else
+              host, guest = v.split(":", 2)
+              host = Vagrant::Util::Platform.windows_path(host)
+              # NOTE: Docker does not support UNC style paths (which also
+              # means that there's no long path support). Hopefully this
+              # will be fixed someday and the gsub below can be removed.
+              host.gsub!(/^[^A-Za-z]+/, "")
+            end
+            puts "Host: " + host
+            puts "Guest: " + guest
+            puts host
             v = [host, guest].join(":")
           end
           ['-v', v.to_s]
```

I can't guarantee the patch doesn't break other platforms, but it works for my case.
I have exactly the same issue but your patch does not fix it. Is docker-toolbox via vagrant a supported setup at all?
Right so I just checked, it also does not work in Command Prompt, same error. I guess only WSL is supported for Windows?

Also does not work with Vagrant installed in WSL and connected WIndows docker, same error. Quite obviously Vagrant's volume mounting in Windows is broken for the Docker provider. Is this official bug ticket tracking system or do we need to file it somewhere else?
I've opened https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/pull/9531 to fix this issue, can someone please review.

issue.title: Fixes #9085: Cannot `up` a machine with Docker Toolbox and Git Bash

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.title: Convert windows paths for volume mounts on docker driver

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
Fixes #9085 

This pull request brings in the PR #9531 and adds a unit test for its behavior.

body:
I'm going to lock this issue because it has been closed for _30 days_ . This helps our maintainers find and focus on the active issues.

If you have found a problem that seems similar to this, please open a new issue and complete the issue template so we can capture all the details necessary to investigate further.
